	at

org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.ProcessMonitor.monitorProcess(ProcessMonitor.java:49)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.ProcessMonitor.access$0(ProcessMonitor.java:42)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.ProcessMonitor$1.run(ProcessMonitor.java:62)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:536)

IProcess#getLaunch can return null.

For example on a Terminate with the process selected.

The process is told to terminate.

Then the launch manager is told to removed the launch (ensuring that for the 
terminated process, getLaunch will return null...that is the launch is no 
longer registered).

The process receives notification that it has indeed terminted and fires the 
terminated event.

Your handleDebugEvent method is called->getLaunch will return null.

I updated the comment on IProcess#getLaunch() to hopefully remove any confusion.
You will need your null check.
Re-assigning to PDE to close/mark as fixed.
